intro: Keysseria pinguiculiformis, commonly known as the sticky leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, green leaves that secrete a sticky substance to trap small insects. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is known for its succulent species adapted to arid environments. Keysseria pinguiculiformis typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology and carnivorous-like adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
